file.name: openapi.yml
file.content:
openapi: 3.0.1
info:
  title: businessProcess
  description: >-
    This is a generated connector for [WorkDay Business Process REST API v1](https://community.workday.com/sites/default/files/file-hosting/restapi/index.html) OpenAPI specification.

    The WorkDay business process service enables applications to access information on event actions and details
  x-ballerina-init-description: >
    The connector initialization requires setting the API credentials. 
 
    Follow [this guide] https://credentials.workday.com/docs/authentication/ and obtain tokens.
  x-ballerina-display:
    label: Workday Business Process
    iconPath: "icon.png" 
  version: v1
tags:
- name: eventSteps
  description: Returns a collection of business process event steps based on the specified
    parameters. Only event steps that are awaiting action from the processing person
    are returned.
- name: events
  description: "Returns a collection of events based on the specified parameters.\
    \ You must specify either the worker or initiating worker query parameter. If\
    \ you did not specify the worker nor the initiating worker parameter, this method\
    \ returns an empty response. \n\nThis operation returns the most recent results\
    \ first. The results are sorted in descending order of the creation date of the\
    \ event.\n\nSecured by the Business Process Security Policy for each event."
- name: types
  description: Returns all business process types. Secured by Public Business Processes.
- name: Prompt Values
  description: Retrieves instances that can be used as values for other endpoint parameters
    in this service.
paths:
  /eventSteps:
    get:
      tags:
      - eventSteps
      summary: Retrieves business process event steps.
      operationId: getBusinessProcessEventSteps
      description: |-
        Retrieves a collection of business process event steps. You can filter the event steps by business process, creation date, due date, and step type.

        Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes

        Scope: Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans
      parameters:
      - name: businessProcess
        in: query
        description: The business process type of the event that the step is associated
          with.
        style: form
        explode: true
        schema:
          type: array
          items:
            type: string
      - name: createdOnOrAfter
        in: query
        description: The last moment the step was updated.
        schema:
          type: string
          format: date
      - name: createdOnOrBefore
        in: query
        description: The last moment the step was updated.
        schema:
          type: string
          format: date
      - name: dueDateOnOrAfter
        in: query
        description: Returns the due date for this step.
        schema:
          type: string
          format: date
      - name: dueDateOnOrBefore
        in: query
        description: Returns the due date for this step.
        schema:
          type: string
          format: date
      - name: limit
        in: query
        description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default
          is 20. The maximum is 100.
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: offset
        in: query
        description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
          The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging
          of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response
          returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.'
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: stepType
        in: query
        description: Retired. We retire this report field because when there are multiple
          steps on the business process definition that are associated with this event
          step, this report field doesn't return the step type for each associated
          step. We recommend that you use the Step Type report field instead.
        style: form
        explode: true
        schema:
          type: array
          items:
            type: string
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: '#/components/schemas/EventStepsSummary'
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /events:
    get:
      tags:
      - events
      summary: Retrieves business process events.
      operationId: getBusinessProcessEvents
      description: |-
        Retrieves a collection of business process events based on the specified parameters. You must specify exactly one worker parameter. If a worker parameter is not specified, returns a blank response.

        Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes

        Scope: Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans
      parameters:
      - name: businessProcess
        in: query
        description: The business process type associated with the business process.
          Returns filterable search results. Use with the Business Process Type data
          source.
        style: form
        explode: true
        schema:
          type: array
          items:
            type: string
      - name: completedOnOrAfter
        in: query
        description: The date and time the business process was completed.
        schema:
          type: string
          format: date
      - name: completedOnOrBefore
        in: query
        description: The date and time the business process was completed.
        schema:
          type: string
          format: date
      - name: initiatedOnOrAfter
        in: query
        description: The date and time this business process was initiated.
        schema:
          type: string
          format: date
      - name: initiatedOnOrBefore
        in: query
        description: The date and time this business process was initiated.
        schema:
          type: string
          format: date
      - name: initiator
        in: query
        description: The ~worker~ that initiated the business process. Please do not
          use this field in a condition rule for the initiation step of a process,
          as it will not return results. This is because there is no initiating ~worker~
          designated until the process has started. The Initiating ~Worker~ field
          only gets a value after the event is initiated (after the process is submitted).
        style: form
        explode: true
        schema:
          type: array
          items:
            type: string
      - name: limit
        in: query
        description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default
          is 20. The maximum is 100.
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: offset
        in: query
        description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
          The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging
          of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response
          returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.'
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: status
        in: query
        description: Transaction Status for Facet Search
        style: form
        explode: true
        schema:
          type: array
          items:
            type: string
      - name: worker
        in: query
        description: Event about ~Worker~ for Facet Search
        schema:
          type: string
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: '#/components/schemas/EventDetails'
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /events/{id}/completedSteps:
    get:
      tags:
      - events
      summary: Retrieves completed steps for a business process event.
      operationId: getCompletedStepsBusinessProcess
      description: |-
        Retrieves all business process steps that are completed for the specified buinesss process event.

        Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes

        Scope: Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans
      parameters:
      - name: id
        in: path
        description: The Workday ID of the resource.
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      - name: limit
        in: query
        description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default
          is 20. The maximum is 100.
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: offset
        in: query
        description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
          The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging
          of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response
          returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.'
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: '#/components/schemas/CompletedStepsView'
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /types:
    get:
      tags:
      - types
      summary: Retrieves all business process types.
      operationId: getAllBusinessProcessTypes
      description: |-
        Retrieves a collection of business process types.

        Secured by: Public Business Processes
      parameters:
      - name: limit
        in: query
        description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default
          is 20. The maximum is 100.
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: offset
        in: query
        description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
          The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging
          of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response
          returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.'
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: '#/components/schemas/BusinessProcessTypeView'
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /events/{id}/attachments:
    get:
      tags:
      - events
      summary: Retrieves attachments for a business process event.
      operationId: getAttachmentBusinessProcessEvent
      description: |-
        Retrieves attachments on the specified business process event that the processing user has permission to view.

        Secured by: Public Business Processes

        Contains attachment(s)
      parameters:
      - name: id
        in: path
        description: The Workday ID of the resource.
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      - name: limit
        in: query
        description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default
          is 20. The maximum is 100.
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: offset
        in: query
        description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
          The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging
          of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response
          returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.'
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: '#/components/schemas/EventAttachmentsView'
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /types/{id}:
    get:
      tags:
      - types
      summary: Retrieves a business process type.
      operationId: getBusinessProcessTypeByID
      description: |-
        Retrieves the business process type specified by the id.

        Secured by: Public Business Processes
      parameters:
      - name: id
        in: path
        description: The Workday ID of the resource.
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/BusinessProcessTypeDetails'
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /eventSteps/{id}:
    get:
      tags:
      - eventSteps
      summary: Retrieves a business process event step.
      operationId: getBusinessProcessEventStepByID
      description: |-
        Returns a business process event step. Returned results are secured based on processing person's view access to the event to which the step belongs. If the processing person does not have view access to the event, when this API is called, they will not be able to retrieve the event step and receive a 404 error.

        Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes

        Scope: Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans
      parameters:
      - name: id
        in: path
        description: The Workday ID of the resource.
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/EventStepsView'
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /events/{id}/comments:
    get:
      tags:
      - events
      summary: Retrieves comments for a business process event.
      operationId: getCommentsBusinessProcessEvent
      description: |-
        Retrieves comments on the specified business process event.

        Secured by: Core Navigation

        Scope: Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans
      parameters:
      - name: id
        in: path
        description: The Workday ID of the resource.
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      - name: limit
        in: query
        description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default
          is 20. The maximum is 100.
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: offset
        in: query
        description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
          The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging
          of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response
          returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.'
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: '#/components/schemas/Comments'
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /events/{id}/inProgressSteps:
    get:
      tags:
      - events
      summary: Retrieves in progress steps for a business process event.
      operationId: getInProcessStepsBusinessProcessEvent
      description: |-
        Retrieves all business process steps that are currently in progress for the specified business process event.

        Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes

        Scope: Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans
      parameters:
      - name: id
        in: path
        description: The Workday ID of the resource.
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      - name: limit
        in: query
        description: The maximum number of objects in a single response. The default
          is 20. The maximum is 100.
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: offset
        in: query
        description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
          The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging
          of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response
          returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.'
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      responses:
        200:
          description: Successful response. A successful response can return no matched
            data.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: object
                properties:
                  data:
                    type: array
                    items:
                      $ref: '#/components/schemas/StepsInProgressView'
                  total:
                    type: integer
                    format: int64
                description: collection something or other
        400:
          description: Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        401:
          description: Invalid resource or operation. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        403:
          description: User has insufficient permissions. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        404:
          description: Resource not found. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
        default:
          description: An error occurred.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
  /eventSteps/{id}/deny:
    post:
      tags:
      - eventSteps
      summary: Denies a business process event step.
      operationId: deniesBusinessProcess
      description: |-
        Denies the business process event step specified by the ID of the originating event step. The processing person must have view access to the event.  In the request body, specify these required fields: id (the event step you are denying), stepAction{id} (if there are multiple event steps), comment.

        Secured by: Core Navigation, Public Business Processes

        Scope: Adaptive Planning for the Workforce, Adaptive Planning for Financial Plans
      parameters:
      - name: id
        in: path
        description: The Workday ID of the resource.
        required: true
        schema:
          type: string
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/BusinessProcessStepsDeny'
        required: true
      responses:
        201:
          description: Resource created.
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                $ref: '#/components/schemas/BusinessProcessStepsDeny'
        400:
          description: |-
            Invalid request. (https://community.workday.com/rest/error-messages)
            Error Code | Validation Message
            --- | ---
            A183 | This event step cannot be denied
            A212 | This event step is not awaiting your action.

      description: |-

          is 20. The maximum is 100.
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64
      - name: offset
        in: query
        description: 'The zero-based index of the first object in a response collection.
          The default is 0. Use offset with the limit parameter to control paging
          of a response collection. Example: If limit is 5 and offset is 9, the response
          returns a collection of 5 objects starting with the 10th object.'
        schema:
          type: integer
          format: int64

components:
  schemas:
    INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE:
      required:
      - id
      type: object
      properties:
        id:
          pattern: ^(?:(?:[0-9a-f]{32})|(?:[0-9]+\$[0-9]+)|(\S+=\S+))$
          type: string
          description: wid / id / reference id
        descriptor:
          type: string
          description: A description of the instance
          readOnly: true
        href:
          type: string
          description: A link to the instance
          readOnly: true
    ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE:
      required:
      - error
      type: object
      properties:
        error:
          type: string
          description: A description of the error
    VALIDATION_ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE:
      allOf:
      - $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
      - type: object
        properties:
          errors:
            type: array
            description: An array of validation errors
            items:
              $ref: '#/components/schemas/ERROR_MODEL_REFERENCE'
    FACETS_MODEL_REFERENCE:
      type: array
      items:
        type: object
        properties:
          descriptor:
            type: string
            description: A description of the facet
          facetParameter:
            type: string
            description: The alias used to select the facet
          values:
            type: array
            description: the facet values
            items:
              required:
              - id
              type: object
              properties:
                count:
                  type: integer
                  description: The number of instances returned by this facet
                  format: int32
                id:
                  pattern: ^(?:(?:[0-9a-f]{32})|(?:[0-9]+\$[0-9]+)|(\S+=\S+))$
                  type: string
                  description: wid / id / reference id
                descriptor:
                  type: string
                  description: A description of the facet
                href:
                  type: string
                  description: A link to the instance
                  readOnly: true
        description: This object represents the possible facets for this resource
        readOnly: true
    MULTIPLE_INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE:
      type: object
      properties:
        total:
          type: integer
        data:
          type: array
          items:
            $ref: '#/components/schemas/INSTANCE_MODEL_REFERENCE'
    BusinessProcessTypeDetails:
      allOf:
      - type: object
        properties:
          helpText:
            type: string
            description: The help text for the initiation step of a business process.
            example: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, cum choro singulis consectetuer ut,
              ubique iisque contentiones ex duo. Quo lorem etiam eu.
            x-workday-type: Rich Text
          descriptor:
            type: string
            description: A preview of the instance

          id:
            type: string
            description: Id of the instance

      allOf:

        properties:

          id:
            type: string
            description: Id of the instance
